speke shulde speke or myght speke/ wolde haue spoken shulde haue spo­
ken or myght haue spoken/ or had spoken: whiche dyuersites of signi­
fication is euer lymytted by the verbe/ that goeth before que/ by whom
may easely be gethered for whiche of these englysshes the frenche in­
diffinite tens serueth.

The preter parfit tens/ as que ie áye parlé that I haue spoken.

The preter plusperfit tens/ as que ie évsse parlé that I had spoken.

The future tens/ as que ie avráy parlé that I shall haue spoken.

The potenciall mode hath two tenses: whiche/ al be it that they signi­
fie rather a maner and an affection in doyng of a dede/ than any directe
tyme/ yet let vs call ie parleróye I wolde speke shulde speke or myght
speke the present tense: and ie avróye parlé I shulde haue spoken wolde
haue spoken or myght haue spoken the preter parfit tens.

¶ The imperatiue mode hath .ii. tenses/ whiche he boroweth of the other
modes here afore rehersed. His present tens boroweth his parsones of




the same tenses in the indicatiue and subiunctiue mode/ as párle speke.
The future tens/ whiche boroweth al his parsons of the present tens of
the subiunctiue mode/ as Que ie párle let me speke.

The optatiue mode boroweth also his .ii. tenses of the subiunctiue/ the pre­
sent tens/ as bién parlé il well speke he or wel myght he speke/ the indif­
finit tens/ as bien parlást il wel myght he haue spoken or shuld haue spoken.

The condicional mode boroweth al the tenses of the indicatiue mode/ the
subiunctiue mode and the potencial mode/ saue only the present tens of
the subiunctiue mode: and to hym selfe propre he hath no tens in this tong/
as sy ie párle, sy ie parlóye, sy ie parláy, sy iay parlé, sy iauóye parlé si ie par­
leráy, sy ie parlásse, sy i ye parlé, sy iéusse parlé, sy ie avr y parlé, sy ie par­
leróye, sy ie avróye parlé. The infinitiue mode hath .ii. tenses/ the present
tens/ as parlér to speke/ the preter perfit tens/ as auóyr parlé to haue spoken.

¶ And note/ that though we vse indifferently in our tong/ I dyd speke
or I spake/ in the frenche tong/ betwene the preter perfit tens and the ind­
diffinite tens there is a great difference/ as I shal more playnely in the
thyrde boke in this place declare.


The thyrde accident.


¶ Circumlocutyng of al the preter tenses/ for all the preter perfit tenses
and preter plusperfit tenses of al verbes actiues in the frenche tong and
the future tens of al subiunctiue modes/ be circumlocuted with the ten­
ses of ie ay and the participle preterit/ like as by the same tenses of ie párle
I haue here gyuen example. ¶ And note that the participle preterit af­
ter the tenses of ie ay remayneth for the most part vnchanged/ what soe­
uer nombre or parson the tenses of ie ay represent/ as by the examples of
all the .iii. coniugations here after playnly shal appere: but of this thyng
I shal haue better occasion to speke here after/ and specially in the thyrde
boke/ in the chapter of participles.


The fourth accident.


¶ Nombres be .ii. in eche of these tenses/ except the tenses of the infini­
tiue mode/ the singular nombre and the plurell.


The fyft accident.


¶ Parsons in eche of these .ii. nombres be .iii.the first singular/ whiche
serueth only for ie. The seconde singular/ which serueth only for tu. The
thirde/ whiche serueth for al other pronownes partitiues/ distributiues
and numerals/ and all substantiues/ whan we speke but of one.
The fyrst parson plurell/ whiche serueth onely for novs. The seconde
plurel/ whiche serueth onely for uovs. The thyrde person plurel/ whiche
serueth for all other pronownes partityues/ distributyues/ and nume­
rals: and also all substantyues/ whan we speke of many.

¶ And note that eche of the tenses in euery of the sayde modes hath .iii.




distinct wordes in his singular nombre and .iii. in his plurell/ to serue
to the wordes here afore rehersed: saue/ as I haue sayde/ that the infi­
nitiue mode hath neyther nombre nor parson/ And that the present tens
of the imperatyue mode wanteth his first parson singular. The present
& indiffinit tenses of the optatiue mode is most comonly vsed in the thyrde
parsones onely: howe be it they may haue altheyr nombres & parsones.


The .vi. accident.


¶ Coniugations be .iii. The fyrst coniugation through al his coniuga­
tyng is euer of many sillables: and hath his present tens and participle
preterit endyng e/ beyng all one in wryttyng/ and differynge onely in
accent/ and his infinitiue mode endyng euer in Er al .iii. wordes beyng
of equall syllables/ as Ie párle, iay parlé, parlér. ¶ And note/ that of this
coniugation be mo than halfe of the verbes parsonals in the frenche tonge
The seconde coniugation is euer also of many sillables/ and hath his pre­
sent tens endyng in is/ his participle preterit in y/ and his infinytyue
mode in yr/ all .iii. wordes beyng of equal sillables/ as ie conuertís, iay
conuertý conuertýr. And these for the most part be circumlocuted in our
tong with I make or I waxe/ as Ie blanchis I make or waxe whyte/ ie
noyrcis I make or waxe blacke: and so in maner of al other colours may
be formed a verbe of this coniugation.

¶ The thirde coniugation hath his present tens in maner euer endyng
in sometyme of one syllable/ as Ie combás I fyght/ ienténs I vnderstande/ 
ie corrómps I corrupte/ ientreméts I meddyll: Whose indiffinite ten­
ses ende euer also in s/ hauynge before s eyther y/ in/ ev/ or v/ as ie
fís, ie prins, ie recévs, ie bvs: Sometyme of one syllable/ sometyme of
many. And theyr participles preterit ende euer in s/ t/ v/ or y/ as iay
prins, iay dit, iay batú, iay recév, iay dormy: sometyme of one syllable/
sometyme of many. Theyr infinite modes ende eyther in re or in yr/
euer of many syllables/ as bátre, téndre, corrómpre, méttre, dormyér.

¶ An approbacion of al these rules here afore rehersed by thexemple of
ie párle, ie conuertís, and ie fais: whose coniugatynge through al their
modes/ tenses/ nombres/ and parsons/ shall here/ accordyng to the sayd
rules/ consequently appere.


The fyrst coniugation.
Of the indicatiue mode. The present tens.


Ie párle tu párles il párle, novs parlóns uovs parléz ilz párlent.


The preter imparfit tens.


Ie parlóye tu parlóys il parlóyt, nous parlións uous parliéz ilz parlóient.





The indiffinit tens.


Ie parláy tu parlás il parlá, nous parlásmes uous parlástez ilz parlérent.


The preter parfit tens.


Iay parlé tu as parlé il a parlé, nous auóns parlé uous auéz parlé ilz ont
parlé


The preter pluperfit tens.


Iayóye parlé tu auóys parlé il auóyt parlé, nous auións parlé uous auiez
parlé ilz auóyent parlé.


The future tens.


Ie parleráy tu parlerás il parlerá, nous parleróns uous parleréz ilz
parléront.


Of the subiunctyue mode
The present tens.


Que ie párle que tu, que nous parlións que u; Ai in the frenche tong is sounous parliéz
quilz párlent.


The indiffinit tens.


Que ie parlásse que tu parlásses quil parlást, que nous parlissións que uous
parlissiéz quilz parlássent.


The preter perfit tens.


Que ie áye parlé que tu áyes parlé quil ayt parlé, que nous ayóns parlé
que uous ayéz parlé quilz áyent parlé.


The preterpluparfit tens.


Que ie évsse parlé que tu évsses parlé, que nous evssións parlé
que uous evssiéz parlé quilz évssent parlé.


The future tens.


Que ie avráy parlé que tu avrás parlé quil avrá parlé, que nous avróns
parlé que uous avréz parlé quilz avrónt parlé.


Of the potenciall mode.
The present tens.


Ie parleróye tu parleróys il parleróyt, nous parlerións uous parleriéz
ilz parleroyent.


The preter perfit tens.


Ie avróye parlé tu avróys parlé il avróyt parlé, nous avrións parlé uous
avriéz parlé ilz avróyent parlé.


Of the imperatiue mode.
The present tens.


Parlé or parlé tu, parlé il, parlóns or parlóns nous, parléz or parléz uous,
párlent or párlent ilz.


The future tens.


Que ie párle que tu parles quíl párle, que nous parlións que uous parliéz
quilz párlent.





Of the optatiue mode. The present tens


Bién párle ie bien párles tu bien párle il, bien parlións nous bien parlíes
uous bien párlent ilz.


The indiffinite tens.


Bien parlásse ie bien parlásses tu bien parlást il, bien parlissións nous bien
parlíssez uous bien parlássent ilz.


The signe of the condicional mode vsed before the
present tens of the indicatiue mode. as


Si ie párle si tu párles sil párle, si nous parlóns si uous párlez silz párlent,
and so in lyke wyse vsyng si before all the nombres and parsons of all
the tenses of the indicatiue mode/ subiunctiue mode/ except his present
tens/ and all the tenses of the potencial mode/ accordyng as the englisshe
shall require/ and as I haue afore rehersed.


Of the infinitiue mode.


The present tens parler, the preterparfit tens auoÿr párle.


The seconde coniugation.
Of the indicatiue mode. The present tens.


Ie conuertís tu conuertýs il conuertít, nous conuertissóns uous conuertis­
sés ilz conuertissént.


The preter parfit tens.


Ie conuertissóye tu conuertissóys il conuertissóyt, nous conuertissións uous
conuertissiéz ilz conuertissóyent.


The indiffinit tens.


Ie conuertís tu conuertiýs il conuertít, nous conuertismes uous conuer­
tistes ilz conuertírent.


The preter parfit tens.


Iay conuertý tu as conuertý il a conuertý, nous auóns conuertý uous auéz
conuertý ilz ont conuertý.


The preterpluparfit tens.


Iauóye conuertý tu auóys conuertý il auóyt conuertý, nous auións conuer­
tý uous auiez conuertý ilz auoyént conuertý.


The future tens.


Ie conuertiráy tu conuertirás il conuertirá, nous conuertiróns uous con­
uertires ilz conuertirónt.


Of the subiunctiue mode. The present tens.


Que ie conuertýe que tu conuertýes quil conuertýe, que nous conuertyóns
que nous conuertýez quilz conuertýent.


The indiffinite tens.


Que ie conuertísse que tu conuertísses quil conuertíst, que nous conuertis­
sións que uous conuertissíez quilz conuertíssent.


The preter parfit tens.





Que ie áye conuertý que tu áyes conuertý quil áyt conuertý, que nous ay­
óns conuertý que uous áyez conuertý quilz áyent conuertý.


The preter pluperfit tens.


Que iévsse conuertý que tu évsses conuertý quil evst conuertý, que nous evssi­
óns conuertý que uous evssíez conuertý quilz évssent conuertý.


The future tens.


Que iavráy conuertý que tu avrás conuertý quil avrá conuertý, que nous
avróns conuertý que uous ávrez conuertý quilz avrónt conuertý.


Of the potencial mode. The present tens.


Ie conuertiróye tu conuertiróys il conuerty róyt, nous conuertirións uous
conuertiríez ilz conuertiróyent.


The preter perfit tens.


Iavróye conuertý tu avróys conuertý il avróyt conuertý nous avrións con­
uertý uous avríez conuertý ilz avróyeut conuertý.


Of the imperatiue mode. The present tens.


Conuertýs or conuertýs tu, conuertýe or conuertýe il, conuertissóns or con­
uertissóns nous, conuertíssez or conuertíssez uous, conuertíent or conuer­
tíent ilz.


The future tens.


Que ie conuertýe que tu conuerttýýs quil conuertýe, que nous conuertións
que uous conuertýez quilz conuertýent.


Of the optatiue mode. The present tens.


Bien conuertýe íe bien conuertíes tu bien conuertýe il, bien conuertyóns
nous bien conuertíez uous bien conuertýent ilz.


The indiffinit tens.


Bien conuertísse ie bién conuertisses tu bien conuertíst il, bién conuertissións
nous bien conuertissíez uous bién conuertíssent ilz.

The vse of si before the tenses I haue afore shewed
in the coniugatynge of Ie párle.
Of the infinitiue mode.

The present tens conuertýr, the preter perfit tens avóyr conuertý.

¶ And note/ that after thexemple of these .ii. verbes the lernar may know
howe to coniugate mo than .iii. partis of .iiii. of the verbes actiues par­
sonal in the frenche tong: and that a great deale more certaynly than the
verbes of the Greke or Latin tong may be lerned by any exemples/ that
be gyuen of them: for the frenche tonge vseth neuer augmentation ney­
ther chronical nor sillabical in theyr fyrst sillables/ as the Grekes vse to
do through all theyr preterit tenses/ nor mutation from one vowell to
another by reason of composicion/ like as the Latins do: nor in the mean
sillables any changyng of consonantes/ other than the present tens hath/
as the Grekes moche vse: nor sondrie terminations of the preterit ten­




ses/ lyke as the Latins vse: for the fyrst and mean sillables of all verbes
of these .ii. coniugations remayne euer vnchanged/ saue that I fynde
sixe verbes/ whiche hauyng in the .iii. parsons of theyr singular nombre/
in theyr present tenses/ this diphthong ev/ change it through all the re into ov/ appe: Of Riba I shall here after in this boke
touche/ and in my thyrde boke at the length declare: So that hauynge
any parson of a verbe/ of eyther of these .ii. coniugations/ if the lernar
can perfitly these two exemples/ he may easely fynde out the first parson
of the present tense of the indicatyue mode/ and than coniugate theym
through al theyr modes/ tenses/ nombres/ and parsons/ by addyng of su­
che terminations to the sayde fyrst parson/ as he fyndeth added to inie
p rle and ie conuertýs.


Of the thyrde coniugation.


¶ In verbes of theyr thyrde coniugation I fynde a litell more difficul­
tie: howe be it by certayne generall rules of this coniugation also to
brynge the lernar to a certaynte .x. rules be to be noted.


Ten general rules to instruct the lernar/ howe he may be sure
to coniugate all verbes/ actiues/ parsonals/ of
the thyrde coniugation in this tong.


¶ fyrst of the present tens of the indicatiue mode/ the fyrst and seconde
parsons singular be euer lyke/ endyng in s/ and the thyrde parson sin­
gular is formed of them/ by changyng s into t: so that hauyng the first
parson singular of this tens/ this rule serueth for the other .ii. parsons.
But in the .iii. parsons plurel of the same tens/ I fynde no generall cer­
taynte in the vowelles and consonantes that they put before ons, ez, and
ent: Howbeit for the most parte the seconde and thirde persons plurell
kepe euer the same vowelles and consonante a before es and ent. that the
first persone plurell hath before ons. Example/ where the letters of the
thre persons plurell before their finall terminations be dyfferent/ nous
faisóns vovs fáictez ilz font, novs disóns vovs dictéz ilz disent, novs bevuons
uovs bevuéz ilz bóyuent. Example where the sayde letters be lyke/ novs
prennóns uovs prennéz, ilz prénnent, novs mettóns, uovs mettéz, ilz mét­
tent. novs mordóns, uovs mordéz, ilz mórdent. So that for the most parte
it shall suffice if I hereafter in the table of verbes expresse the first per­
sons singuler and plurell of this tens onely/ Howbeit somtyme it shall
be nedefull to sette forthe as well the first persone singuler as all the thre
persons plurell distinctly/ for so moche as I can nat conteyne these said
persons vnder any generall rule certayne.

¶ Seconde/ the fyrst parson singular of the preter imperfit tens of the




indicatiue mode/ is euer formed of the fyrst parson plurell of the present
tens of the same mode/ by changyng of ons into oye/ as of faysóns is for­
med faysóye, of disóns disóye, of bevuóns bevuóye, of prennóns prennóye,
and all suche be coniugate lyke parlóye or conuertissóye: so that hauyng
the fyrst parson singular of this tens/ the other parsones may easely be
coniugate by example of the other coniugations.

¶ Thyrde/ of the indiffinite tense of this mode the fyrst and seconde par­
sones singular be euer lyke/ endyng in s/ as I haue afore touched: and
the thyrde parson singular is formed of them/ by changyng of s into t/
hauyng before s and t/ eyther y/ v/ ev/ or in/ as I haue also afore de­
clared: and his .iii. parsons plurell ende in smes, stez, and rent, like as
the same parsons do in the fyrst and seconde coniugations/ hauyng euer
before the sayd terminations the vowel or diphthong of theyr singular
nombre. if there comes a vowel or diphthong immediatly before theyr s/
if there come an n before s/ thau they adde to d before rent, as ie dys, tu
tu dys il dit, novs dísmes vovs dístez ilz dírent. ie fis tu fys il fit, novs físmes
uovs fístez ilz fírent. ie bus tu bus il but, novs búsmes uovs bustéz ilz búrent.
ie decévs tu decévs il decévt, novs decévsmes uovs decévstez ilz decévrent.
Ie prins tu prins il print, novs prínsmes uovs prínstez ilz príndrent. So the
onely the fyrs parson singular of this tens is vncertaynne/ but that ones
had/ the lernar may be certayn by this rule to forme the residue of al his
parsons in both nombres.

¶ And note/ that often tymes it happenneth/ that the singular nombre
of this tense is lyke the singular nombre of the present tense in the same
mode specially in the seconde coniugation/ as appereth by Ie conuertýs.

¶ fourth/ syns al the preter parfit and pluparfit tenses of al modes/ and
also the future tens of euery subiunctiue mode/ of al verbes actiues par­
sonals/ be circumlocuted with the tenses of ie ay/ and the participle pre­
terit/ as I afore declared and shewed by example of ie párle and ie con­
uertís, in al these tenses is no maner difficulte/ but the participle preterit
ones had/ the lernar may coniugate all these tenses by thexemple of the
other .ii. coniugations/ as bycause the participle preterit of ie fais, is
faict, I must say iay faict, iauóye faict, i ye faict, iévsse faict, ie avráy faict
iavróye faict, auoyér faict/ puttyng suche and as many tenses of ie ay before
faict/ as I haue done before parléé and conuertý.

¶ fyft/ onely the fyrst parson singular of the future tens in this mode/
is vncertayne/ but that ones knowen/ he may certaynly be coniugate by
texemple of ie parleráy or conuertiráy, as feráy ferás ferá, feróns feréz fe­
rónt: and lyke as of parler y is formed parleróye , so of the fyrst parsone
singular of this tense is euer formed the fyrst parson syngular of the pre­
sent tens of the potencial mode: whiche person ones knowen/ al his other




parsons may easely be coniugate by exemple of parleróye, as of fer y is
formed feróye, by changyng of ray into roye, and coniugate feróye, feróys
feróyt, ferións feriéz feróyent. of prendráy prendróye prendróys pren­
dróyt, prendrións prendríéz prendróyent. and so of al other.

¶ Sixt/ the fyrst and thyrde parsons singular of the present tens of the
subiunctiue mode be euer like/ endynge in e/ and the seconde parson syn­
gular addeth to s. The fyrst and seconde parsons plurell change e of
the fyrst parson singular into ions and iez. The thyrde parson plurell
addeth nt to the fyrst parson singular: so that onely the fyrst parson sin­
gular of this tens is vncertayne: whiche ones hadde/ howe the residue
shulde be formed/ I haue shewed the lernar in this rule/ as if he ones
knowe we that the fyrst parson singular of this tens is Que ie fáce, he may
knowe by my rule/ that he maketh que tu fáces quil fáce, que novs facións
que uovs faciéz quilz fácent. and in likewise que ie díe que tu dies quil die, que
novs dións que uovs diéz quilz díent, puttynge no consonant before ions
and iez: except the fyrst parson singular haue one/ as que ie préigne que tu
préignes quil préigne, que novs préignóns que uovs preignéz quilz préignent.

¶ Seuenth/ by the addynge of these sixe terminations se, ses, t, sións,
siéz, sent, to the fyrst parson singular of the indiffinit tens in the indica­
tyue mode/ the lernar shal forme the same tens in the subiunctiue mode
in all his nombres and parsons: as of ie fis is formed ie fisse tu fisses il fist,
novs fissións uovs fisséz ilz físsent. and in like wyse of ie recévs is formed
ie recéusse tu recévsses il recévst, novs recevssións uovs receussiéz ilz recévs
sent. & of ie prins ie prínsse tu prínsses il prinst, novs prinssións uovs prins­
siéz ilz prínssent. and of ie tins ie tínsse tu tínsses il tinst, novs tinssíóns uovs
tinssiez ilz tínssent, kepynge euer in this tens/ before the terminations/
the vowell of the same tense in the indicatyue mode/ and n also/ if the
sayde tense haue n.

¶ Eyght/ of the present tens of the imperatiue mode the thirde parsons
singular & plurel be euer lyke the same persons in like tens of the subiun­
ctyue mode/ and the fyrst and seconde parsons plurell be euer lyke 
the same parsons of like tens in the indicatiue mode: so that onely the
seconde parson singular is vncertayne: howe be it for the most part the
seconde parson singular of this tens is like the same parson of the pre­
sent tens in the indicatyue mode: so that so often as the seconde parsone
singular of this tens is like the same parson of the present tens in the in­
dicatyue mode/ I shall in the table of verbes leaue this parsone vnre­
hersed/ remittyng the lernar to this generall rule: and whan he differ­
reth from the sayd seconde parson I shal expresse hym in the table of ver­
bes next before the infinitiue mode: but of this thyng I shall in my an­
notacions vpon this .viii. rule in my thirde boke intreat more at length.




so that after the lernar knowe ones that the seconde parson singular of
this tense is fay/ he may be sure by this rule/ that he is thus coniugate fay
fáce faysóns faictéz fácent. And in lyke wyse dy dýe, disons dictéz dýent.
pren préigne prennóns prennéz prééignent.

¶ Nynth/ the future tense of the imperatiue mode/ and the present tens
of the optatyue mode be euer like to the present tense of the subiunctiue
mode/ and the indiffinite tense of the optatyue mode is lyke the same tens
in the subiunctiue mode. And the condicional mode in this coniugation
is vsed before suche and so many tenses as he is in the other .ii. coniuga­
tions/ without any maner change.

¶ Tenth/ the present tens of the infinitiue mode is euer also vncertayne.


Approbations and applyeng of these ten general ru­
les by the coniugatynge of ie fays.
Of the indicatiue mode. The present tense.


Ie fais tu fais il fait, novs faisóns uovs faictéz ilz font. In whiche tens the
fyrst parsone singular and all the .iii. parsons plurel be vncertayne/ and
howe the seconde and thyrde parsons singular be formed appereth in the
fyrst of the ten generall rules.


The preter imperfit tense.


Ie faisóye tu faisóys il faisóyt, novs faisións uovs faisiééz ilz faisóyent. Whose
fyrst parson singular is formed of faisóns/ whiche is the first parson plu­
rel of the present tense/ by changyng of ons into oye: and the other par­
sons be varied like parlóye or conuertissóye hauyng before oye, oys, oyt,
ións, iéz, óyent the vowel or consonant that cometh before ons in the sayd
fyrst parson plurel: as I haue declared in the seconde of the .x. generall
rules. 


The indiffinite tense.

Ie fis tu fis il fít, novs físmes uovs fistéz ilz fírent. Whose fyrst parson syn­
gular only is vncertayne/ whiche ones knowen/ howe the residue of his
parsons shulde be formed/ I haue sufficiently declared in the thyrde of
the .x. generall rules.


The preter perfit tense.


Iay faíct tu as faict il a faict, novs auóns faict uovs auéz faict ilz ont faict.
varyenge onely the tenses of ie ay/ and kepyng styll the participle vn­
changed: as I haue in the fourth of the .x. general rules/ and also in the
rule of the thyrde accident of verbes actiues parsonal declared.


The preter plusperfit tense.


I auoye faict tu auóys faict il auóyt faict, novs auions faict uoys auiéz faict
ilz auóyent faict accordyng to the sayd fourth rule.


The future tense.


Ie feráy tu ferás il fera, novs feróns uovs ferez ilz feront. whose fyrst par­




son singular only is vncertayne i whiche ones knowen/ all the other per­
sons be formed lyke parleráy/ puttyng in the stede of ray for the other per­
sons ras, ra, rons, rez, and ront, with suche vowels and consonantes as
come before ray in the fyrst parson singular/ accordyng as I haue decla­
red in the fyft of the .x. general rules.


Of the subiunctyue mode.
The present tens.


Que ie fáce que tu fáces quil fáce, que novs facións que uovs faciéz quilz
fácent. Whose fyrst parson singular onely is vncertayne: whiche ones
knowen/ howe the residue of his parsons shulde be formed/ I haue suf­
ficiently declared in the .vi. of the .x. general rules/ puttyng euer before
es, ións, iéz, and ent suche vowels and consonantes as come before e in
the sayd fyrst parson syngular.


The indifinite tens.


Que ie físse que tu físses quil fist, que novs fissións que uovs fissiééz quilz fís­
sent. Whose first parson singular howe he is euer formed of the first par­
son singular of the indiffinite tense of the indicatiue/ and to suche vowel
as cometh before s in the indicatiue mode addeth se, ses, st, sións, siééz,
sent, I haue in the .vii. of the .x. general rules playnly declared.


The preter perfit tense.


Que iáye faict que tu áyes faict quil áye faict, que novs ayóns faict que uovs
ayéz faict quilz áyent fáict, coniugate accordyng as I haue in the fourth
of the .x. general rules playnly declared.


The preter plusperfit tense.


Que ie évsse faict que tu évsses faict quil evst faict, que novs evssións faict que
uovs evssiéz faict quilz évssent faict, coniugate accordyng as in the sayde
fourth rule I haue declared.


The future tense.


Que ie avráy faict que tu avrás faict quil avrá faict, que novs avróns faict
que uovs avréz faict quilz avrónt faict, coniugate accordyng as I haue in
the sayd fourth rule declared.


Of the potencial mode. The present tens.


Ie feróye tu feróys il feróyt, novs ferións uovs feriéz ilz feróyent. Whose
fyrst parson singular is formed of the fyrst parson singular of the future
tense in the indicatiue mode/ by changyng of ray into roye/ and howe he
kepeth the same letter before róye, roys, royt, rións, riéz, royent, that the
sayde future hath before ray/ I haue afore declared in the fyft of the ten
generall rules. The preter perfit tense.

Iavróye faict tu avróys faict il avróyt faict, novs avrións faict, uovs avriez
faict ilz avróyent faict, coniugate accordyng as I haue in the sayd fourth
rule declared.





Of the imperatiue mode. The present tense.


Fay or fay tu, fáce or fáce il, faysóns or faysóns novs, faictéz or faictéz uovs,
fácent or fácent ilz, whose seconde parson singular onely is vncertayne/
and the thyrde parsones singular and plurell lyke the same parsones of
the present tense of the subiunctiue mode/ and the fyrst and seconde par­
sons plurell/ lyke the same parsons of the present tense of the indicatyue
mode/ accordyng as I haue in the eyght of the .x. generall rules suffici­
ently/ declared. 
The future tense.

Que ie fá ce que tu fáces quil fáce, que novs facións que uovs faciéz quilz fá­
cent, lyke the present tense of the subiunctiue mode/ differyng only in sig­
nification: for in the one que ie fáce signifieth that I do/ and in the other
let me do/ accordyng as I haue in the nynth of the .x. general rules afore
declared. 


Of the optatiue mode.
The present tens.


Bien fáce ie bien fáces tu bien fáce il, bien facións novs bien faciéz uovs bien
fácent ilz, in all thyng like the same tense of the subiunctiue mode/ accor­
dyng as I haue touched in the nynth of the .x. general rules.


The indifinite tense.


Bien físse ie bien físses tu bien fist il, bien fissións novs bien fissiéz uovs bien
físsent ilz, in all thyng like the same tense of the subiunctiue mode/ accor­
dynge to the sayd nynth rule.


Of the potentiall mode.


The present tense lyke the present of the indicatiue.
Si ie fays si tu fays sil fait, si novs faisóns si uovs faictéz silz font. and so si ie
faysóye, si ie fys, si iay faict, si iauóye faict, si ie feráy, si ie físse, si iáye faict,
vráy faict, si ie feró Ai in the frenche tong is sounute;ye, si iavróye faict, accordynge as
the englysshe requireth/ puttynge si before all the nombres and parsons
of the sayd tenses/ lyke as I haue done here in the present tense of the in­
dicatiue mode/ so as I haue declared in the nynth of the .x. general rules.


Of the infinitiue mode. The present tense.


Faire, whiche is vncertayne/ accordyng as I dyd in the .x. rule touche.


The preter perfit tense.


Auoýr faict, accordyng as I shewed in the fourth of the .x. general rules.
So that by these .x. general rules/ and applyeng of them as for exemple
to the coniugatyng of ie fais/ appereth that in some verbes of this thirde
coniugation there be .viii. of theyr persons besides theyr participle preterit &
infinitiue mode/ whiche can nat be brought vnder any general rule cer­
tayne. But for to coniugate the most part of all suche verbes as be con­
teyned vnder this coniugation/ it shal suffice if the lernar may knowe
onely .v. of theyr parsons besides theyr said participle preterit and infi­
nitiue mode: so that these .vii. wordes or at the most .x. ones knowen the




lernar may by the helpe of these said .x. general rules coniugate euery verbe
of this coniugation completely through the residue of his modes/ tenses/
nombres/ and parsons/ like as I haue here done ie fais. Wherefore in this
thyng also to bryng the lernar vnto a certaynte/ in the table of verbes/
which shalbe in the thyrde boke/ so often as any verbe of this coniuga­
tion/ shal after the order of a/ b/ c/ fortune to come in place/ I shal reherce
these sayd .vii. wordes or .x. at the most/ as I haue here in the said .x. ge­
neral rules made mencion of them for the residue of theyr hole coniuga­
tyng/ remittyng the lernar to my sayd generall rules/ whiche well stu­
died/ I am certayne shalbe sufficient.

¶ And note that there is none of the sayd .x. general rules so vniuersal­
ly certayne/ but that some fewe exceptions I fynde agaynst them/ as shal
in my thyrde boke/ whan the sayd .x. rules come in place to be spoken of/
more playnely appere/ but they be very fewe. And so often as any verbe
of this coniugation shal fortune to come in question/ if the lernar do re­
sort to the table of verbes/ he shal there fynde al suche exceptions/ as far
as concerneth to that verbe/ set out in order. But to be certayne of this
thynge through al the verbes of the tong/ let the lernar resort to myn an­
notations vpon these .x. generall rules in the thyrde boke/ and he shall
there clerely be satisfied of al thyng that concerneth the perfection of the
tonge in this behalfe.

¶ Note also that these .ii. coniugations be so vtterly distinct amonge
them selfe/ that there is no verbe that hath his tenses sometyme like one
of them and somtyme lyke an other/ saue onely ie ménge I eate/ whiche
through al his other tenses/ beyng coniugate like ie párle/ maketh for his
indiffinit tenses ie mengús, whiche I fynde written ie mengévs, and que ie
mengússe or mengévsse coniugate like the thyrde coniugation/ where if he
folowed the rule/ he shulde make ie mengáy or ie mengeáy, & ie mengásse
or mengeásse, and ie me accórs, whiche in his present tenses of the indica­
tiue mode and imperatiue mode foloweth the thirde coniugation/ in al his
other tenses he is coniugate like ie me fie & ie párle & a fewe other/ whereof
I shal make mention in my thyrde boke in my annotations vpon this note.

¶ Note also/ that as far as I haue hitherto noted/ there is no verbe ac­
tiue parsonal in this tong/ but he hath as many sondry modes/ tenses/
nombres/ and parsons as ie párle, ie conuertýs, and ie fais haue, excepte
ie sévls I am wont/ and ienseuelýs I buried: whiche howe many mo­
des and tenses they haue/ I shall here expresse.


Of the indicatiue mode. The present tense.


¶ Ie sevls tu sevls il sevlt, novs sovlóns uovs sovléz ilz sevlent.


The preter perfit tense.


Ie sovlóye formed of sovlóns after the seconde of the .x. general rules.





The indiffinite tense.


Ie sovlús tu soylús il sovlút nos sovlúsmes uous sovlustéz ilz sovlúrent.


The infinityue mode.


Sovlóyr, and mo tenses/ nombres/ or parsons/ this verbe hath nat/ so that
for I haue be wont/ I had be wont/ & I shalbe wont/ they say iay aprins
or iay acoystumé, iauoye apríns, and iavráy aprins, and so forth in other
modes/ borowynge the tenses of ie ay/ and these participles aprins or a­
covstumé. 


Of the indicatyue and subiunctiue modes.
The indiffinite tenses.

Ienseuelís tu enseuelís il enseuelít, novs enseuelísmes uovs enseuelistéz ilz
enseuelírent. Que ienseuelísse que tu enseuelissís.


The preter perfit and plusperfit tenses through all the modes.


As iay enseuelý, iauóye enseuelý, que iáye enseuelý, que iévsse enseuelý,
que iavráy enseuelý, iavróye enseuelý.


The infinitiue mode enseuelir.


So that for the other tenses they vse the tenses of ie entérte, whiche is of
the fyrst coniugation: and therefore of all the verbes actiues parsonall/
I call onely these twayne in the frenche tong verbes defectiues.

¶ Note also that the mean sillables of verbes/ natwithstandyng theyr
coniugatyng remayne euer vnchanged. saue that certayne verbes of the
fyrst coniugation change ev of theyr present tens into ov/ like as I haue
afore touched/ as ie plevre, ie demévre, ie trevue, nous plovróns, nous de­
movróns, nous trovuóns, and so kepyng ov through all theyr coniuga­
tyng beside. Except also certayne verbes of the thyrde coniugation/ whi­
che in some tenses haue a and in some e/ as ie apérs, ie apparóye, iappa­
rús, iay apparú, ie apperáy, que iappére, and fewe lyke of whiche in the
thyrde boke I wyl speke in this place more at length.

¶ Note also/ that for so moche as these .iii. verbes ie uevlx I wil/ ie puís
I may/ and ie doybs I owe/ come often in vse in this tong/ and that in the
formation of some of theyr parsons they do alter from the .x. general ru­
les/ and farthermore want somtyme of theyr persons/ and somtyme a hole
mode/ like as the verbes defectiues in this tong do/ I thynke it necessa­
rie to shewe here in this place/ howe these sayd .iii. verbes be coniugat/
where it shalbe requisit coniugatyng them at the length/ and where as
they folowe the sayd .x. general rules/ to remit the lernar to them.


Of the indicatiue mode.


Ie uveil or ie uevlx tu uevlx il uevlt, novs uovlóns uovs uovléz ilz uévllent.
Ie uovlóye, formed of uovlóns coniugate like parlóye.
Ie uovlús tu uovlús il uovlút, novs uovlúsmes uovs uovlústéz ilz uovlúrent.
Iay uovlú, iauóye uovlú, like iay parlé, iauóye parlé. &c.
Ie uovldráy tu uoyldrás. &c. kepyng d before the terminations of this tonse.





Of the subiunctiue mode.


Que ie uveílle que tu uveílles quil uveílle, que novs uveillóns. &c.
Que ie uovlsísse, whiche/ if he folowed the rule/ shulde make uovlússe, con­
iugate Vovlsísses uovlsíst, uovlsissións uovlsissiéz uovlsissent.
Que iáye uovlú. &c. Que iévsse uovlú. &c. Que iavráy uovlú. &c. lyke as in
other verbes. 


Of the potencial mode.


Ie uovldróye, formed of uovldráy, coniugate lyke parleróye.
Iavróye uovlú. &c. 


Of the imperatiue mode.


Vevlx, uveílle, uovlóns uovléz uveíllent.

Que ie uveílle que tu uveílles quil uveílle, que novs uveillións que uovs uveilliéz
quilz uueíllent. 


Of the optatiue mode.


Diev uveílle, uovlsist diev, vsed onely in the thyrde parsones singular.

And of the condicional mode is no difficulte.


The infinitiue mode uovloír and auoýr uovlú.



Of the indicatiue mode.


Ie puys or ie pevlx tu puys il pevlt novs povóns uous povéz ilz pévuent.

Ie povóye. &c. Ie pevs tu pevs il pevt, nous pevsmes uous pevstéz ilz pévrent.

Iay pev. &c. Iauóye pev. &c. Ie povrráy. &c.


Of the subiunctyue mode.
The present tens wanteth.


The indiffinit shulde make ie pévsse, and so Alayn Chartier and Fros­
sart vseth theym: but I fynde more in vse ie puýsse tu puýsses il puist or
puýsse. &c. Que ie aye pev. &c. Que ievsse pev. &c. Que iavráy pev. &c.


Of the potentiall mode.


Ie povrróye. &c. Ie avróye pev. &c. The imperatiue mode wanteth.


Of the optatiue mode.


The present tense wanteth. The indiffinite bien puísse ie, bien puísses tu,

bien puísse il, bien puissións novs. &c. The infinitiue mode povuoýr and
auoýr pev. Of the indicatiue mode.

Ie doybs tu doybs il doybt, novs deuóns uovs deuéz ilz dóyuent.

Ie deuóye. &c. Ie devs tu devs il devt, novs dévsmes uovs devstéz ils devrent

Iay dev. &c. I auóye dev. &c. Ie deueráy tu deuerás. &c.


Of the subiunctiue mode.


Que ie dóye que tu dóyes quil dóye, que novs doyións que uovs doyiéz
quilz dóyent. Que ie dévsse que tu dévsses quil devst, que novs devssións. &c.
Que iáye dev. &c. Que iévsse que tu dévsses quil devst, que novs devssións. &c.
Que iáye dev. &c. Que iévsse dev. &c. Que iavráy dev que tu avrás dev. &c.


Of the potencial mode.


Ie deueróye tu deueróys. &c. Iavróye dev tu avróys dev. &c.
The imperatiue mode and optatiue come seldome or neuer in vse/ if they
do/ howe they be formed appereth in the .x. generall rules.


The infinitiue mode debuoýr and auoýr dev.





¶ Note also that generally through out al this tong/ all maner verbes
whether they be actiues or meanes/ kepe through al theyr modes/ tenses/
nombres/ and parsons one selfe letter at theyr begynnyng/ howe so euer
theyr latter terminations be varied/ for expressyng of theyr diuerse mo­
des/ tenses/ and parsons: so that the selfe letter/ that the fyrst parsone of
the present tense in the indicatiue mode hath/ the selfe letter is kept through
out al his coniugatyng: except onely .iii. ie ay I haue/ ie men uas I go/
and ie svis I am of whiche howe ie ay altereth his fyrst letter a into o/
and e shall here by his coniugatynge appere differryng to speke of the
other twayne/ tyll I shall come to speke of verbes meanes and verbes
passiues in this tong.


The coniugatyng of ie ay I haue.


Ie ay tu as il a, novs auóns uovs auéz ilz ont.

Ié auóye tu auóys il auóyt, novs auións uovs auiéz ilz auoyent.

Ie evs tu evs il evt, novs évsmes uovs evstéz ils évrent.

Iay ev tu as ev il a ev. &c. Ie auóye ev tu auóys ev il auóyt ev. &c.

Ie avráy tu avrás il avrá, novs avróns uovs avréz ils avrónt.

Que ie áye que tu áyes quil ayt or quil áye, for I fynde both in vse/ que novs

ayóns que uovs ayéz quilz áyent.
Que ievsse que tu évssez quil evst, que novs evssións que uovs evssiéz quilz évssent.

Que iáye ev que tu áyes ev quil ayt ev. &c. Que ie évsse ev que tu évsses ev

quil evst ev. &c. Que iavráy ev que tu avrás ev quil avrá ev. &c.
Ie avróye tu avróys il avróyt, novs avrións uovs avriéz ilz avróyent.

Que ie avróye ev que tu avróys ev. &c. Imper. Ay tu ayt il, auóns auéz áyent.

Que ie áye que tu áyes quil ayt, que novs ayóns que uovs ayéz quilz áyent.

Bien áye bien ayes bíen ayt or bien áye. &c. Bien evsse bien évsses. &c.

Si ie ay, si ie auóye, si ie evs, si iay ev. &c. Auoár, auoár ev.

¶ Note also/ that though the Latins haue many other sortes of verbes
personalles besydes actiues/ as neuters/ deponentes/ commons/ neutre
passiues/ and suche other/ in this tong I comprehende al maner verbes
personals vnder the verbe actiue or the meane: and yet all theyr meane
verbes folowe one of these .iii. coniugations: as shall here after imme­
diatly appere: for all theyr verbes passiues be circumlocuted with the
tenses of ie svis/ and theyr participle preterit (whiche I therfore may al­
so call passyue) hauyng no maner coniugation propre vnto them selfe/
like as the preter perfit and plusperfit tenses/ with the future of the sub­
iunctiue mode of al theyr verbes actiues be circumlocuted with the ten­
ses of ie ay and the same participle/ and haue vnto them no coniugatyng
propre/ as the other tenses haue. So that hauyng well these .iii. verbes
ie párle, ie conuertás, ie fais, and the .x. general rules here afore rehersed/
the lernar may be sure/ howe to coniugate all the verbes personalles of




this tonge/ wherof I haue nat here made expresse mencion: for eyther
they be comprehended vnder the fyrst and seconde coniugations: and
than thexamples of ie párle and ie conuertýs is sufficient to coniugate
them by: orels they be comprehended vnder the thyrde coniugation/ and
than hauyng .vii. wordes/ or at the most .x. wordes that be vncertayne/
whiche the lerner shalbe sure to fynde out in the table of verbes/ these
sayd .x. general rules and example of ie fays shall sufficiently helpe hym
in all them: For if any verbe happen in some one parsone or tense to be
excepted/ whiche be very fewe/ I shal in the sayd table/ whan I reherce
the sayd .vii. or .x. wordes/ make therof also expresse mention at length.
And nowe to speke of the residue of the .x. accidentes belongyng to ver­
bes actiues parsonalles.


The .vii. accident.


¶ Formation/ for somtyme verbes be formed of substantyues/ as of me­
rite meritér, of mur emmurér, téérre enterréér, of póvldre empovldrér, of che­
mý}n cheminér, of bras embrassér, and suche lyke. Some be formed of ad­
iectiues/ as of blánche blanchýr, noyíre noyrcýr, róvge rovgír, gávne gav­
nír, dóvlce adovlcýr, meísgre ameisgrír. ¶ And note/ that for the most
part all suche in our tong be circumlocuted with I make or I wax/ and
our adiectiue/ as blanchýr I make or waxe whyte/ noyrcir I make or
waxe blacke/ as I haue afore touched whan I shewed that al such ver­
bes were of the seconde coniugation/ Some be formed of aduerbes/
as of pres approvchér, of loyng esloyngnér.


The .viii. accident.


¶ Composition. for some be symple/ and nat compounde of any other
worde/ as dýre, faire, mézttre, ueoýr, ovýr, seóyr, dormýr, and suche like:
Some be compounde with an imperfit worde/ whiche by hym selfe signi­
fieth nothyng in the frenche tong/ and yet greatly altreth the verbe from
his signification/ whan he is a simple: as mes and for/ whiche in our tong
we also vse/ saue that we call mes mys/ as díre is to say mesdíre to mys­
say: faire to do/ mesfaire to mysdo/ not that before all verbes we maye
put mes/ but where soeuer he is thus vsed/ he thus altreth the significa­
cion of the simple. For/ as faire to do/ forfaire to forfait or fordo: clórre
to schutte/ forclórre to schutte out or forschut.

¶ And note/ that these sortes of composicion be more vsed in the Rommant
of the rose/ and of Alayn Chartier/ than they be of suche as haue written
syth theyr tyme.

Some be compounde of substantiues commynge before them/ as mayn­
tenýr to mayntayne. Some be compounde of adiectiues commynge be­
fore them. Some be compounde of preposicions commynge before them/
as enténdre, soubzméttre, povrueoír, contredíre. as for instávrer, conclúrre,




atténdre, substituér, be holly taken out of the latin tong/ and al suche haue
euer like signification in this tong/ as they haue in latin.
Some be compounde of aduerbes commynge before them/ as maldire
to curse/ bienuiegnér to welcome.


The .ix. accident.
¶ Addyng of syllabicall adiections in affirmation and negation.



In affirmation.


¶ For often tymes they put en next before theyr verbes/ whan they af­
firme a thyng to be done/ whan he signifieth nothyng/ but onely as a si­
gne of affirmation/ vsed rather to make the sentence more fulle in sounde
to the eare/ than for any necessite: and yet before some verbes they vse
hym twyse for the sayd consyderation: as uovs en avréz, nen parléz plus, il
sen est en álle, il sen est en fový, and suche lyke/ where the sence is alone if
I leaue en out and say uovs avréz, ne parléz plus, il sest álle, il sest fový.


In negacion.


¶ For where as they put ne before theyr verbes/ so often as they expresse
negation/ like as we vse nat in our tong after our verbes. They put al­
so after theyr verbes pas, poynt, or mýe/ whiche of theym selfe signifye
nothyng/ but onely be as signes of negation: Howe be it/ it is nat in the
spekars pleasure to vse one of the sayd .iii. wordes or nat/ lyke as it is of
en in theyr affirmations: for in maner there is no verbe that hath ne a­
fore hym/ but he must haue eyther pas, poynt, or mye after hym.

¶ And note that betwene pas and poynt is no maner difference/ but it
is in the spekars or writtars election/ whether he wyll vse the one or the
other/ but as for mýe is an olde Rommant worde/ and nowe out of vse/
where the ryght frenche is spoken.


The .x. accident.


¶ Order different from our tonge in interrogations: for where as we
whan we aske a question of a nowne substantiue/ whether he betoken a pro­
pre name or nat/ vse in maner euer to put the sayd substantiue as the last
worde of the interrogation: as whyther goeth the kyng? where is Char­
les? is my gowne clene? haue you sadled my horse? in the frenche tonge
they name the substantyue fyrst/ and demaunde theyr question of hym af­
terwarde/ as le roy ou sen va il? Charles ou est il? ma róbe est élle nétte? mon
cheual lauéz vovs sélle? And though this order be sometyme broken/ the
surer way is for sauyng the right grace of the tong/ to vse suche order in que­
stions demaunded by substantiues/ as I haue here shewed: Howe be it
in questions demaunded by pronownes/ the pronowne in the frenche sen­
tence is euer the last worde/ whether he be so in our tong or nat: as whi­
ther go you? Ou alléz vovs? whan shal he come? quant viendrá il? where
dwell they? Ou demévrent ilz? Howe be it they say for/ is he come? Est il




uenú? and therfore more certaynly I differ to speke of this matter/ tyl I
shall come in the thyrde boke in this place.


Of the verbes meanes.


¶ Whiche be verbes meanes in this tong I haue in a generalte al redy
declared: vnto whom I haue gyuen this name for .ii. causes: One/ for
so moche as determynatly they betoken neyther action nor passion: for
where as the doar and sufferer ought to be distinct parsons/ the acte of
these verbes retourneth euer to the doar agayne. An other/ for where as
of euery verbe/ whiche signifieth an acte to be done without forth/ may
be circumlocuted a passiue with the tenses of ie svis and theyr participle
preterit: whiche shal in dede betoken sufferyng by the act of some par­
son without forth: in suche verbes as be meanes we can nat do so: but
these thynges shal in the thirde boke in this place more playnly appere.
Howe be it some thynge more playnely here to shewe the lernar/ howe
he shall knowe suche verbes as in the frenche tong be vsed as meanes.
In maner generally all suche verbes as signifie a parsone to do an acte
eyther with his mynde/ hole body/ or any part therof/ of whiche the dede
retourneth to the doars selfe agayne/ and betoken none acte to passe from
hym without forth/ al suche verbes in this tong be vsed as meanes.


Example of suche verbes as signifie
the actes of the mynde.


¶ I maruayle/ I wonder/ I trust/ I dispaire/ I reioyce/ I take thought/
I doubt/ I agree/ I consent/ I complayne/ I waxe angrye/ I waxe sorie/
I waxe prowde/ and in maner all suche verbes as signifie any passion
of pleasure or displeasure to the mynde.


Example of suche verbes as signifie
the actes of the hole body.


¶ I lye downe/ I aryse/ I bowe downe/ I stande vp/ I go/ I walke/ I
moue/ I flye away/ I dye/ I ryse from dethe/ and in maner al suche ver­
bes as signifie the hole body to be in occupacion/ and the acte taketh his
effect in the body selfe.


Example of suche verbes as signifie the parti­
cular actes of the partes of ones body.


¶ I mocke/ I laugh/ I syt downe/ I leane/ I knele/ I holde my peace/
I crye out/ I frowne/ and suche lyke: Whiche verbes greatly differ from
I see/ I heere/ I feele/ I smell/ I handel/ I pusshe/ I stryke/ I beholde/
I call/ and suche other/ though these actes be also done with the partes of
ones body: for the fyrst signifie none acte to passe from the doar without
forth/ and the other betoken/ that there is some other thyng that is seen/
herd/ felt/ smelled/ handled/ pusshed/ stryken/ behelde/ or called. But for so
moche as this rule is nat so vtterly general/ but that I fynde exceptions




in al these sayd .iii. sortes of verbes: for I fynd ie pénce, ie sónge, ie mónte
ie descéns, and certayne other/ whiche thoughe they signifie the actes of
the mynde or body/ and betoken no dede without forth/ yet they be euer
vsed in this tonge as actiues. And farther more/ that where as we haue
one worde/ the frenchemen vse circumlocution/ and somtyme contrary:
where we vse circumlocution/ the frenchemen haue one onely worde/ as
where we say I stande/ they say ie me tiéns de bout: and where we saye
I holde my peace/ they say ie me tays.
To brynge the lernar out of all maner doubtes/ whiche verbes in this
tong/ besydes them that I haue here rehersed/ be vsed as meanes/ and
whiche nat: and also whiche be circumlocuted/ and whiche be expressed
by one onely worde/ I shall more playnely declare this thynge in the
thyrde boke in this place: but specially in the table of verbes/ where af­
ter the order of a/ b/ c/ so often as any verbe of our tong shall fortune to
come in place/ it shall appere in the frenche verbe/ nat onely what coniu­
gation he is of/ but also whether he be vsed in theyr tong as a meane or
nat: and whether he be circumlocuted in our tonge or in theyrs: orels
be expressed in both the tonges or in one of them by one onely worde.
Verbes meanes haue .xi. accidentes: of whiche .ix. be suche and the selfe
same that verbes actiues haue: that is to say/ mode/ tense/ nombre/ par­
son/ coniugation/ formation/ composicion/ addynge of syllabicall adie­
ctions/ and order different from our tong in interrogations.
¶In the thyrde accident/ that is to say/ circumlocutynge of t; Ai in the frenche tong is sounhe preter
tenses they differ moche from verbes actiues: for where as verbes acti­
ues circumlocute theyr preter perfit and plusperfit tenses throughe all
theyr modes/ and the future tense of the subiunctiue mode/ with the ten­
ses of ie ay and the participle preterit/ All verbes meanes circumlocute
all the same tenses/ with the tenses of ie suis and the same participle/ with
a farther difference also: for where as the participle preterit/ ioyned to
the tenses of ie ay, remayneth in maner euer vnchanged/ as I haue afore
in the fyrst note of the thyrde accident belongynge to verbes actiues/ al
redy declared. Whan he is ioyned to the tenses of ie suis/ he altreth his
gender and nombre/ accordyng to the gender and nombre of the nomi­
natyue case/ that gouerneth the sayd tenses of ie suis.
¶ And note/ that though the tenses of ie suis be of farre different signi­
fication from the tenses of ie ay yet so often as any of his tenses is put
before a participle of a meane verbe/ they haue the selfe same significa­
tion that the tenses of ie ay haue/ as shal here after in theyr coniugatynge
playnely appere.

¶ The .xi. accident/ by whiche also they differ from verbes actyues/ is
doublyng of the pronowne/ for in token that the act of all suche verbes




retorneth to the doar agayne/ they put forthe most part before euery of
theyr first and seconde parsons/ the accusatiue case of the pronowne that
gouerneth them/ and before the thyrde parsons as well singular as plu­
rel se, what so euer pronowne or substantiue be nominatiue case to any
suche verbe: whiche thyng playnely by example to declare vnto the ler­
nar/ I shall here immediatly coniugate ie me fíe, ie me esbahýs, and ie
men fuýs, Notyng first that though I double the pronowne before eue­
ry parson of them for exemple/ I fynde them many tymes vsed without
any suche doublyng/ and in all thynges lyke actiues/ especially in theyr
fyrst and seconde parsons: but in theyr thyrde parsons of both the nom­
bres/ I fynde them very seldome vsed without se before them/ as I shal
in the thyrde boke in this place more playnely declare.


The coniugatyng of ie me fíe, whose final terminations
are changed after ie párle, and are lyke the first
coniugation of verbes actyues.



Of the indicatiue mode. The present tense


¶ Ie me fíe tu te fies il se fíe, novs novs fións uovs uovs fiéz ils fient.


The preter imperfit tense.


Ie me fióye tu te fióyes il se fióyt, novs novs fijóns uovs uovs fijéz ilz se
fióyent. The indiffinite tense.
Ie me fiáy tu te fiás il se fiá, novs novs fiásmes uovs uovs fiastéz ilz se fiérent.


The preter perfit tense masculine.


Ie me suis fíe tu ten es fíes il sen est fíe, novs novs sommes fiéz uovs uovs estez
fiéz ilz sen sunt fiéz.


The preter perfit tense feminine.


Ie me suis fiée tu ten es fiée élle sen est fiée, novs novs sómmes fiées uovs
uovs estéz fiées élles sen sont fiées.

¶ And note/ that the preter perfit and preterplusperfit tenses of al meane
verbes/ and the future tense of the subiunctiue mode/ varye theyr parti­
ciple/ accordynge as I haue afore shewed by rule/ and here declared by
example: and therfore in the other tenses/ bycause of breuite/ I wyl shew
onely howe the fyrst parsons alter theyr gender and nombre.


The preter plusperfit tense.


Ie mestoye fíe tu testóyes fíe il sestóyt fíe, novs novs estións fiéz uovs uovs
estiéz fiéz ilz sestóyent fiéz/ Ie mestóye fiée, novs novs estións fiéez.


The future tense.


Ie me fierá y tu te fierás il se fierá, novs novs fieróns uovs uovs fieréz ilz se
fierónt.


Of the subiunctyue mode.






The present tens.


Que ie me fíe que tu te fíes quil se fíe, que novs novs fijóns que uovs uovs
fijéz quilz se fíent.


The indiffinite tense.


Que ie me fiásse que tu te fiásses quil se fiást, que novs novs fijssións que uovs
uovs fijssiéz quilz se fiássent.


The preter perfit tense masculine and feminine.


Que ie me sóye fíe que tu te sóyes fíe quil se foyt fíe, que novs novs soyóns
fiéz que uovs uovs soyéz fiéz quilz se foýent fiéz. Que ie me sóye fiée. &c.


The preter plusperfit tense masculine and feminine.


Que ie me fússe fíe que tu te fússes fíe quil se fust fíe, novs novs fussións fiéz


The future tense masculine and feminine.


Que ie me seráy fíe que tu te serás fíe quil se sera fíe, que novs novs seróns
fiéz que uovs uovs seréz fiéz quilz se serónt fiéz. Que ie me seráy fiée. &c.


Of the potencial mode. The present tense.


Ie me fieróye tu te fieróys il se fieróyt, novs novs fierións uovs uovs fieriéz
ilz se fieróyent.


The preter perfit tense masculine and feminine.


Ie me seróye fíe tu te seróys fíe il se seróyt fíe, novs novs serións fiéz uovs
uovs seriéz fiéz ilz se seróyent fiéz. Ie me seróye fiée. &c.


Of the imperatiue mode. The present tense.


Ie fíe toy, se fíe il, novs fións novs, uovs fiéz uovs, se fíent ilz.


The future tense.


Que ie me fíe que tu te fíes quil se fíe, que novs novs fiións que uovs uovs
fiiéz quilz se fíent.


Of the optatiue mode. The present tense.


Bien me fíe ie bien te fíes tu bien se fíe il, bien novs fiións novs bien uovs
fiiéz uovs bien se fíent ilz.


The indiffinite tense.


Bien me fiásse ie bien te fiásses tu bien se fiást il, bien novs fiissións novs bien
uovs fijssiéz uovs bien se fiássent ilz.


Of the condicional mode. The present tense.


Si ie me fíe, si tu te fíes sil se fíe, si novs novs fións si uovs uovs fiéz silz se fí
ent. and so of the other tenses/ and as many as si may be ioyned vnto/ in
ie párle. Of the infinitiue mode.

The present tense pour me fiér pour mauóyr fíe for to haue trusted.


The coniugatyng of ie me esbahýs, whose final terminations
are changed after ie conuertýs, and are like the se­
conde coniugation of verbes actyues.






Of the indicatiue mode. The present tense.


Ie me esbahýs tu te esbahýs il se esbahýt, novs novs esbahissóns uovs
uovs esbahisséz ilz se esbahíssent.


The preter imperfit tense.


Ie men esbahissóye tu te esbahissóys il se esbahissóyt, novs novs esbahissi­
óns, uovs uovs esbahissiéz, ilz se esbahissóyent.


The indiffinite tense.


Ie men esbahýs tu ten esbahýs il se esbahýt, novs novs esbahísmes uovs
uovs esbahistéz ilz se esbahírent.


The preter perfit tense masculine and femine.


Ie me suis esbahý tu tes esbahý il sest esbahý, novs novs sómmes esbahýz
uovs uovs estéz esbahýz ilz se sont esbahýz. Ie me suis esbahýe. &c.


The preter plusperfit tense mascu. and femine.


Ie mestóye esbahý tu testóyes esbahý il sestóyt esbahý, novs novs estións es­
bahýz uovs uovs estiéz esbahýz ilz sestóyenstóye esbahý sestóent esbahýz. Ie mestóye esbahý. &c.


The future tense.


Ie men esbahiráy tu tesbahirás il se esbahirá, novs novs esbahiróns uovs
uovs esbahiréz ilz se esbahirónt.


Of the subiunctiue mode. The present tense.


Que ie mesbahýe que tu tes bahýes quil sesbahýe, que novs novs esbahións
que uovs uovs esbahyéz quilz sesbahýent.


The indifinite tense.


Que ie men esbahísse que tu tesbahísses quil sesbahist, que novs novs esbahis­
sións que uovs uovs esbahissiéz quilz sesbahýssent.


The preter perfit tense mascu. and femine.


Que ie me sóye esbahý que tu te sóyes esbahý quil se soyt esbabý que novs
novs soyóns esbahýz que uovs uovs soyéz esbahýz quilz se sóyent esbahý.
Que ie me sóye esbahýe. &c.


The preter plusperfit tense masculine and femine. 


Que ie me fússe esbahý que tu te fússes esbahý quil se fust esbahý que novs
novs fussións esbahýs que uovs uovs fuffiéz esbahýz quilz se fussent esbahýz.
Que ie me fússe eshabýe. &c.


The future tense mascu. and feminine.


Que ie me seráy esbahý que tu te serás esbahy quil se será esbahý, que novs
novs seróns esbahýz que uovs uovs seréz esbahýz quilz se serónt esbahýs.
Que ie me seráy esbahýe. &c.


Of the potential mode. The present tense.


Ie me esbahyróye tu te esbahiróys il se esbahiróyt, novs novs esbahyrións
uovs uovs esbahiriéz ilz se esbahyróyent.


The preter perfit tense masculine and femine.


Ie me seróye esbahý tu te seróys esbahý il se seróyt esbahý, novs novs




serións esbahýs, uovs uovs seriéz esbahýs, ilz se seróyent esbahýs.
Ie me seróye esbahýe.


Of the imparatyue mode the present tens.


Te hesbahis toy, se esbahÿe il, novs esbahissóns nous, uovs esbahysses
uovs, sesbahihent ilz.

Que ie me esbahýe, tu te esbahÿes, il se esbahÿe, que novs novs esbahýons
uovs uovs esbahýez, il se esbahýent.


Of the optatyue mode the presentens.


Bien me esbahýe ie, bien te esbahíes tu, bien se esbahíe il, bien novs esba­
hyóns nous, bien uovs esbahiéz uovs, bien se esbahyent ilz.


The indiffinit tens.


Bíen me esbahysse ie, bien te esbahisses tu, bien se esbahyst il, bien novs es­
bahyssións novs, bien uovs esbahýssiez uovs, bien se esbahýssent ilz.


The condicionall mode the presentens.


Si ie mesbahys, si tu tesbahys, sil sesbahyst, si novs novs esbahyssóns, si
uovs uovs esbahisséz, silz sesbahýssent, and so forthe of the other tenses.


Of the infinityue mode the present
and preterparfitens.


Pour mesbahýr to wondre, pour mestre esbahý, for to haue wondred.


The coniugatyng of Ie men fuys, whose finall termynations be chaun­
ged after ie fays, and is lyke the the thirde coniuga­
tion of verbes actyues.



Of the indicatyue mode the presentens.


¶ Ie men fvys I flye/ tu sen fvys, il sen fvyt, novs novs fvyóns, uovs uovs
fvyéz, ilz sen fvýent. 


The preterimparfitens.

Ie men fuyóye, tu ten fuyóys, il sen fuyóyt, novs novs fuyyóns, uovs uovs
fuyýez, ilz sent fuyóyent. 


The indiffinit tens.


Ie men füýs, tu ten füýs, il sen füÿt, novs novs füýsmes, uovs uovs füýstez,
ilz sen f&vacute;ýrent. 


The preterparfitens mas. & femy.


Ie men svis füý, tu teu es füý, il sen est füý novs novs sommes füÿz, uovs
uovs estéz füÿz, ilz sen sont füýz. Ie men fuís füÿe. &c.


The preterplusparfitens mascu. and femy.


Ie mestóye füÿ, tu testóys f&vacute;ÿ, il sen estóyt füÿ, novs novs estíóns füÿz, uovs
uovs estiéz füýz, ilz sestóyent füÿz. Ie mestóye füÿe. &c.


The futurtens.


Ie men fvyráy, tu ten fvyrás, il sen fvyrá, nous novs fvyróns, uovs uovs
fvyréz, ilz sen fvyrónt. 


Of the subiunctyue mode the presentens.


Que ie men fvÿe, que tu ten fvýes, quil sen fvÿe, que novs nous fvýións
que uovs uovs füÿez/ quil sen füýent.





The indiffinit tens.


Que ie men füýsse, tu ten füýsses, il sen füýst, novs novs füÿssións, uous uous
füýssiez, ilz sen füýssent.


The preterparfit tens mascu. and femy.


Que ie me soye f&vacute;ý, tu te sóyes füÿ, il se soyt füÿ, novs nous soyóns füÿz,
uous uous soyéz füýs, ilz se sóyent füÿ.


The preterplusparfit tens.


Que ie men fusse füÿ, tu ten f&vacute;sses füý, il sen fust füý, que novs novs füissións
füyz, uovs uovs fuissíéz fvÿz, ilz se fúissent füÿz.


The future tens.


Ie me seróy füÿ, tu te serós füý, il se ser füý, nous nous seróns füýs, uovs
uovs seréz füýz, ilz se serónt füýz.


Of the potenciall mode/ the presentens.


Ie men füÿróye, tu ten füÿróys, il sen füÿróyt, nous nous füÿrións, uous
uovs füÿriééz, ilz sen füÿroýent. 


¶ The preterparfitens.


Ie me seróye füÿ, tu te seróys f&vacute;ý, il se seróyt füý, nous nous serións füýs,
uous uous seriéz füýs, ilz se seróyent füýz.


Of the imparatyue mode/ the presentens.


Ten fvý toy, sen fvýe il, novs fvyóns novs, uovs fvyéz uous, sen fvýent ilz.


The futuretens.


Que ie men fvýe, tu ten fvýes, il sen fvýe, que nous nous fvyóns, uovs uovs
fvyéz, ilz sent fvýent.


Of the optatyue mode/ the presentens.


Bien me fvýe ie, bien te fvýes tu, bien sen fvýe il, bien nous fvyóns nous,
bien uovs füýssiez uovs, bien sen füýssent ilz.


Of the condicionall mode/ the presentens.


Si ie men füýs, si tu ten füýs, sil sen füýt, si nous nous füýóns,
si uovs uous füýéz, sil sen füýent, &c.


Of the infinityfe mode. the presentens & preterparfe.


Pour me füýr, pour mestré füý.

¶ And note/ that suche maner of coniugatyng as I haue here shewed/
that the frenche tong vseth in their meanes/ suche lyke maner of coniuga­
tyng vse they of all verbes actyues/ whiche of their owne nature shulde
signify an acte to passe from the doar without forthe/ so often as they wyll
signify the same acte to retourne to the doar agayne: which maner of re­
ciprocation we expresse in our tong/ by puttyng of these wordes after our
verbes actiues/ my self/ they self/ his or her self/ our self/ your self/ their selfe.
As I conuert is a verbe actyue/ signifyeng thacte of conuertyng to passe




from the doar/ and that there is some body without forthe that is con­
uerted/ but if I wyll adde any of these wordes after the verbe/ and sig­
nifie that the acte of conuertyng retourneth to the doar agayne. I must
vse me, te, se, novs, uovs, and Se before the parsons of the frenche verbe:
As for I conuert my selfe/ thou conuertest thy selfe/ he conuerteth hym
selfe or she her selfe/ we conuert ourselfe/ you conuert your selfe/ they con­
uert themselfe. They saye Ie me conuertýs, tu te conuercýs, il se conuer­
týt, elle se conuertýt, novs novs conuertissóns, uovs uovs conuertisséz, ilz
se conuertíssent: And so thorowe all the other modes/ tenses/ nombres/ &
parsons of Ie conuertýs, lyke as I haue gyuen example of Ie mesbaihýs.

¶ And though whan they vse a verbe actiue in the actiue sens/ they cir­
cumlocute his preterit tens with the tenses of Ie ay, and the participle as
dothe afore appere/ by the said Ie conuertýs, and the other two verbes a­
ctyues. yet so ofte as we shall vse any verbe actyue in this sens/ we shal
circumlocute the sayd preterit tenses with the tenses of ie suis / and the par­
ticiple in euery thyng/ as I haue afore declared/ that verbes meanes do
So that for I haue conuerted my selfe/ I had conuerted my selfe/ that I
haue conuerted my selfe/ that I had conuerted my selfe/ that I shall ha­
ue conuerted my selfe/ I shulde haue conuerted my selfe: They saye Ie
me suis conuertý, ie mestóye conuertý, que ie me sóye conuertý, que ie fússe
conuertý, que ie me seray conuertý, ie me séroye conuertý: usyng the par­
ticiple after the tenses of ie suis, in all thynges/ accordyng as I haue be­
fore shewed/ that they do in verbes meanes.

¶ Note also that amongest suche verbes as of their owne nature be ve­
rye meanes/ I fynde none that be anormale saue onely Ie men uas, as I
haue afore touched/ whiche I wyll also coniugate as I haue done the o­
ther verbes meanes/ natte that his parsones be neuer vsed without dou­
blynge of the pronowne/ but bycause that for the moost parte they be so
vsed/ for the more certayntie howe this verbe shulde also be vsed/ refer­
ryng the lernar to this place in the thirde boke.


The coniugatyng of ie men uas, thorowe all his modes/
tenses/ nombres/ and parsons


Ie men uas, tu ten uas, il sen ua, novs novs allóns, uovs uovs alléz, ilz sen uont.

Ie men allóye, tu ten allóys, il sen allóyt, novs novs allións/ uovs uovs al­
liéz, ilz sen allóyent. Ie men alláy, tu ten alás, il sen allá, novs nous al­
lásmes, uovs uovs allastéz, ilz sen alléret.
Ie men svis en allé, tu ten es en allé, il sent est en allé, novs novs sómmes al
léz, uovs uovs alléz, ilz sent sont en alléz. Ie mestóye allé, tu testóys allé, il
sestóyt allé, novs nous estíóns alléz, uovs uovs estiéz alléz, ilz sestóyent alléz.
Ie men yráy, tu ten yrás, il sen yrá, novs novs yróns, uovs uovs yréz, ilz sen
yrónt. Que ie uóyse or que ie men aillé, que tu uoýses or que tu ten ailles, quil sen




uóyse or quil sen áille, que novs nous aillións, que uovs uovs ailliéz, quilz
sen uóysent or quilz sen áillent.
Que ie men allásse, que tu ten allásses, quil sen allást, que novs novs allis­
sións, que uovs uovs allissíez, quilz sen allássent.
Que ie me sóye allé, que tu te sóyes allé, quil se soyt en allé, que novs novs
soyóns alléz, que uovs uovs sóyes alléz, quilz se sóyent alléz.
Que ie me fússe allé, tu te fússes allé, il se fust en allé, novs novs fuíssións al­
léz, uovs uovs fúissies alléz, ilz se fúissent alléz. 
Que ie me seráy allé, tu te serás allé, il se será allé, novs novs seróns alléz,
uovs uovs séres alléz, ilz se serónt alléz.
Ie men yróye, tu ten yróyes, il sen yróyt, novs novs yrións, uous uovs yríéz
ilz sen yróyent.
Ie me seróye allé, tu te seróys allé, il se seróit allé, novs novs serións alléz,
uovs uovs seríes alléz, ilz se seróyent alléz.
Va, áille il, allóns nous, alléz uovs, sen áillent ilz
Que ie men áille, que tu ten áilles, quil sen áille, que novs novs aillíóns
uovs uovs ailliéz, ilz sent áillent.
Bien áille ie, bien áilles tu, bien áille il, bien aillións
novs, bien ailliéz uovs, bien aillént ilz.
Que bien allásse ie, bien allásses tu, bien allást il, bien allissións
novs, bien állissies uovs, bien allássent ilz
Si ie men uas, si tu ten uas, sil sen ua, si novs novs allóns, si uovs uovs al­
léz, silz sen uont. &c. Allér, estréé allé.
¶ And note/ that where as I haue afore some parsons of this verbe ad­
ded en twyse/ and afore some but ones/ and for some other lefte hym out/
I this haue done onely to warne the lernar/ that all these thre maners
of spekynge they vse differrynge/ to certifie hym in this behalfe/ tyll I
shall come to my annotacyons vpon the .ix. accident of verbes actyues
personals in the thirde boke. 


¶ Of the verbe passyue.


¶ verbes passyues be suche as of their owne nature betoken suffring/
lyke as I haue afore touched/ as I am beaten/ I am bounde/ I am gre­
ued/ I am hurte/ and suche lyke.

Verbes passyues in this tong/ haue no certen coniugacyon/ no more than
they haue with vs in our tong/ for like as we circumlocute our verbes passi­
ues with the tenses of I am/ and the participles preterit of our verbes ac­
tyues/ Sayeng: I am loued/ I was loued/ I haue ben loued/ I had ben
loued/ I shalbe loued/ and so forthe/ ioyning the other modes and tenses
of I am to our sayd participles/ so say they with them Ie suis ayméé, iestóye
aymé, ie fus aymé, iay esté aymé, ia uóye esté aymé, ie seráy aymé, ioyning
the participle preterit of the verbe actyue to the modes/ tenses/ nombres
and parsons of ie suis.





Whose complet coniugation here immediately foloweth.


¶ Ie svys tu es il est, novs sómmes uovs estéz ilz sont.

Iestóye tu estóys il estóyt, novs estións uovs estiéz ilz estóyent.
Ie fus tu fus il fut, novs súsmes uovs fustéz ilz fúrent.
Iay éste tu as éste il a éste, novs auóns éste uovs auéz éste. &c.
Iauóye éste tu auóys éste il auóyt éste, novs auións éste. &c.
Ie seráy tu serás il será, novs seróns uovs seréz ilz serónt.
Que ie sóye que tu sóyes quil soyt, que novs soyóns que uo&vacute;s soyéz quilz sóyent.
Que ie fússe que tu fússes quil fust, que novs fussións que uovs fussiéz quilz fussent.
Que ie áye éste que tu áyes éste quil ayt éste, que novs ayóns éste. &c.
Que ie évsse éste que tu évsses éste quil evst éste, que novs evssións éste. &c.
Que iavróy éste que tu avrás éste quil avrá éste, que novs avróns éste. &c.
Ie seróye tu seróys il seróyt, novs serións uovs seriéz ilz seróyent.
Iavróye éste tu avróys éste il avróyt éste, novs avrións éste uovs. &c.
Suys soyt, soyóns soyéz sóyent.  Be.
Bien sóye bien sóys bien soyt, bien soyóns bien soyéz bien sóyent.
Bien fússe ie bien fússes tu bien fust il, bien fussións novs bien fussiéz uovs
bien fússent ilz.
Si ie suis si tu es sil est, si novs sómmmes si uovs éstes. &c.
Estre, auoýr éste. To be.

¶ And note that for the true circumlocutyng of verbes passiues in this
tong/ the lernar must call agayn to mynde/ what I haue said here afore
in the thirde accident of mean verbes/ where I shewed that suche gender
and nombre as the nominatiue case is/ that commeth before any of the
parsons of ie suis/ of suche lyke gender and nomber shall the participle
be/ whiche foloweth any of the sayd parsons/ for suche like congruite is
obserued betwene all participles passiues and the nominatiue cases that
gouerne the tenses of ie suis/ so often as by the sayd tenses and partici­
ples we expresse passion in this tong/ as shal by the tenses of the indica­
tiue mode of ie suis, ioyned to this participle conuertý / more playnly be
expressed. 


Of the indicatiue mode.



The present tense passiue.


The masculine singular/ ie suis conuertý tu es conuertý il est conuertý.
The masc. plu. novs sómmes conuertíz uovs estéz conuertíz ilz sont conuertíz.
The feminine sing. ie suis conuertýe tu es conuertýe elle est conuertýe.
The fe. pl. novs sommes conuertíes uovs estéz conuertíes élles sont conuertíes.


The preter imparfit tense passiue.


The mas. sing. iestóye conuertý tu estóys conuertý il estóyt conuertý.
The ma. plu. novs estións conuertíz uovs estiéz conuertíz ilz estóyent conuertíz.
The fem. sing. iestóye conuertýe tu estóys conuertýe élle estóyt conuertýe.
The fe. pl. novs estións conuertíes uovs estiééz conuertíes élles sont conuertíes.





The indiffinite tense passiue.


The mascu. sing. is fus conuertý tu fus conuertý il fut conuertý. 
The mascu. plu. novs fúsmes conuertýz uovs fustéz conuertýz. &c.
The fem. sing. ie fus conuertýe tu fus conuertýe élle fut conuertýe.
The fem. plu. novs fúsmes conuertíes uovs fustéz conuertíes. &c.


The preter perfit tense


Iay éste conuertý, iay éste conuertíe, novs auóns éste conuertíz, novs auóns éste conuertíes. The preter plusperfit tense.
Iauóye éste conuertý, iauóye éste conuertýe, novs auóns éste conuertíz, novs
auóns éste conuertíes. 


The future tense.


Ie seráy conuertýe, ie seráy conuertíe, novs seróns conuertíz, novs seróns conuertiz, novs seróns
conuertíes. And so through al the other modes and tenses of ie suis chan­
gyng the gender and nombre of the participle/ whan he foloweth any of
them as I haue here by the tenses of thindicatiue mode clerely declared.

¶ But howe all maner participles forme theyr masculine genders out
of theyr feminines/ and theyr plurel nombres out of theyr singulars/ shal
here after in the chapter of participles more playnly appere.

¶ Note also that the infinitiue mode of al verbes actiues may signifie
both action and passion/ as the sence shal require/ as I shal in the thirde
boke in this place more playnly declare. ¶ And that there be many in­
finitiue modes/ whiche come of verbes passiues onely/ as encéyndre  of ie
suis encéynte, endormýr of ie suis endormý, and suche lyke/ they say nat
ie encéyns, ie endórs in the actiue sence.

¶ Note also/ that where as I haue sayd/ that this maner of circumlocu­
tyng of verbes passiues is general through al the frenche tong I fynde
exception onely in ie nays/ Whiche beyng coniugate like ie fays/ and al­
teryng his final terminations/ as though we were of the thyrde coniuga­
tion of verbes actiues/ saue in his preter tenses/ hath the signification of
a verbe passiue/ as by his coniugatyng shal here consequently appere.

Ie nays tu nays il nayst, novs naissóns uovs naisséz ilz naissent.
Ie naissóye tu naissóys il naissóyt, novs naissións uovs naissiéz ilz naissóyent.
Ie nasquís tu nasquís il nasquít, novs nasquísmes uo[us] nasquitéz ilz nasq[ui]rent.
Iay éste ne, iay éste née, novs sómmes nez, novs sómmes nées.
Iauóye éste ne, iauóye éste née, like the same tenses in other verbes passiues.
Ie naistráy tu naistrás il naistrá, novs naistróns uovs naistréz ilz naistrónt.
Que ie naísse tu naisses il naísse, que novs naissións queuovs naíssiéz queilz naíssent.
Que ie nasquísse que tu nasquísses quil nasquíst, que novs nasquissións que
uovs nasquissiéz quilz nasquíssent.
Que ie áye éste ne, que tu áyes éste née, que nous ayóns éste nez que uovs
ayéz éste nées.
Que iévsse éste ne, que novs évssións éste nez, que iévsse éste née. &c.




Que iavráy éste ne, que ie avráy éste née, que nóvs avróns éste nez. &c.
Ie naistróye tu naistróys il naistróyt, novs naistrións uovs naistriéz ilz
 naistróyent. Ie avróye éste ne, novs avrións éste nez. Iavróye éste néée/.
Nays, naisse naissóns naissééz naissent.
Que ie naisse que tu naisses quil naisse, que novs naissións que uovs naissiééz
quilz naissent.

Bien naísse ie bien naísses tu bien naísse il, bien naíssións novs bien naissiéz
uovs bien naíssent ilz.
Bien nasquisse ie bien naiquísses tu bien nasquíst il, bien naíquissións novs
bien nasquissiéz uovs bien naquíssent ilz.

Naýstre to be borne, auóyr éste ne to haue ben borne.

¶ But of the vse and signification of this verbe/ I shal more speke here
after in the thyrde boke in this place: onely notyng here/ that I fynd in
maner all these tenses circumlocuted after the generall rule of verbes
passiues/ as Ie suis ne, iestóye ne, ie fus ne, ie feráy ne, que ie fóye ne, que
ie fússe ne, and ie seró ne. but other tenses be more vsed of approued au­
ctours. 


Of verbes impersonals.


¶ Verbes impersonals be suche as betokenyng doyng/ will haue none
other nominatiue case before them but onely il/ by reason wherof they
haue neyther nombre nor parson/ but one onely worde in euery of theyr
tenses suche as il requireth.

¶ Verbes impersonals haue suche and as many accidentes as verbes
actyues parsonalles haue/ saue that nombres and parsones they haue
none/ lyke as I haue here afore touched.


In whiche other .ii. accidentes verbes impersonals
differ also from verbes parsonalles.


¶ In coniugation/ and order different from our tong in interrogations/
they differ also from verbes actiues parsonals: for al verbes imparso­
nals be eyther coniugate like the first parsons singular of the fyrst con­
iugation/ or like the same parsons of the thyrde coniugation: so that like
vnto the thyrde parsons of the seconde coniugation is no verbe impar­
sonal coniugate in this tonge. Verbes imparsonals therfore haue but
onely .ii. coniugations/ of whiche the fyrst is lyke il párle il párlóyt il par­
lá. &c. and the seconde like il faict il faisóyt il fit. &c. for lyke il conuertit/
(as I haue sayd) is no verbe imparsonal coniugate in this tong.


Howe verbes of the fyrst coniugation be varied
by the example of il tónne.



Of the indicatiue mode.


The present tense il tónne it thondereth. The preter perfit tense 




il tonnóyt, it did thonder. The indiffinite tense/ il tonná, it thondred. The pre­
ter perfit tense/ il a tónne, it hath thondred. The preter plusperfit tense/ il
auóyt tónne, it had thondred. The future tense/ il tonnerá, it shal thonder.


Of the subiunctyue mode.


The present tense/ quil tónne/ that it thonder. The indiffinite tense/ quil
tonnást, that it thondred. The preter perfit tense/ quil ayt tónne, that it
hath thondred. The preterplusperfit tense/ quil evst tónne, that it hadde
thondred. The future tense/ quil avrá tónne, that it shal haue thondred.


Of the potencial mode.


The present tense/ il tonneróyt, it shulde thonder. The future tense/ il
avróyt tónne, it shulde haue thondred.


Of the imperatiue mode.


The present tense/ tónne, thonder. The future tense/ quil tónne, let it thon­
der. Of the optatiue mode.

The present tense/ bien tónne il, well thonder it. The indiffinite tense/
bien tonnást il, well mought it haue thondred.

The infinitiue mode/ tonnér, to thonder/ auoýr tónne, to haue thondred.

¶ And note/ that of this coniugation I fynde but .viii. other verbes in
this tong/ that is to say/ il escléére it lyghtneth/ il tempéste it stormeth/ il
uénte it bloweth/ il brvýne it misleth/ il neíge  it sneweth/ il grésle it hay­
leth/ il géle it friseth/ il desgéle it thaweth: so that I fynde no verbe imper­
sonall betokenynge any acte or impression of the ayre/ but he is of theyr
fyrst coniugation/ saue onely il plevt it rayneth: whiche is of theyr se­
conde coniugation: But as for il faict chavlt, il faict froyt, il faict noyr, il
faict cler, vsed as imparsonals for it is hote/ it is colde/ it is darke/ it is
clere/ and howe they put il faict before diuerse other adiectiues/ that be­
long nothyng to the qualites of the ayer/ I shal defer to speke of/ tyl I
come to the thyrde boke in this place/ where I wyll also speke of il y a, il y
auóyt, il y fut. c. vsed as impersonals/ for ther is/ ther was/ ther was. &c.

¶ Note here also/ that verbes imparsonals of this coniugation be sel­
dome or neuer vsed in the passiue sence: how be it I may say the riuer is
frosen.


Howe verbes imparsonalles of the seconde coniuga­
cion be varied by the example of il aduiént.
Of the indicatiue mode.


The present tense/ il aduiént, it happenneth. The preter imperfit tense/
il aduenóyt, it did happen. The indiffinite tense/ il aduínt, it happened.
The preter perfit tense/ il a aduernú, it hath happened. The preterplusper­
fit tense/ il auóyt aduenú, it had happened. The future tense/ il aduiendrá,
it shal happen. Of the subiunctiue mode.

The present tense/ quil aduiéngne, that it happen. The indiffinite tens/




quil aduénist, that it might haue happened. The preterprefitens/ quíl ayt
aduénu, that it hath happened. The preterpluperfitens/ quil eust aduénu,
that it had happened. The futurtens/ quil avrá aduénu, that it shall haue 
(happened.


¶ Of the potenciall mode.
 

The presentens/ il aduiendróyt, it shulde happen.
The preterparfitens il avróyt aduénu, it shulde haue happened.


Of the imparatyue mode.


The presentens aduiéngne happen. the futurtens quil aduiéngne, let it
happen. 


Of the optatyue mode.
